raw_text:
Ferguson rues failure to cut gap
 
 Boss Sir Alex Ferguson was left ruing Manchester United's failure to close the gap on Chelsea, Everton and Arsenal after his side's 1-1 draw with Fulham.
 
 Premiership leaders Chelsea and the Gunners endured a 2-2 stalemate on Sunday, giving United the chance to make up some ground in the league. But Ferguson said: "I think what makes it so bad is that both our rivals dropped points at the weekend. "It was a great opportunity - and we haven't delivered." United went ahead through Alan Smith in the 33rd minute before Bouba Diop's superb 25-yard strike cancelled out the visitors' lead in the 87th minute. Ferguson described the result as an "absolute giveaway" after United had earlier missed a host of opportunities to finish off the encounter. He said: "It was a good performance - some of the football was fantastic - but we just didn't finish them off. "In fairness, it's a fantastic strike from the Fulham player." The result leaves Ferguson's side fourth in the league on 31 points - four points behind Arsenal and a further five back from Chelsea.
llama3.2:1b: Manchester United suffered a 1-1 draw against Fulham, leaving them fourth in the Premier League with 31 points after missing opportunities to catch leaders Chelsea and Arsenal.
llama3.2:3b: Sir Alex Ferguson rued Manchester United's failure to close the gap on Chelsea, Everton, and Arsenal after a 1-1 draw with Fulham.
Both rivals dropped points at the weekend, giving United an opportunity to make up ground in the league.

United now sits fourth in the league, four points behind Arsenal and five behind Chelsea.

Ferguson praised their performance but felt they were too few for the job at Premier League level.
He described the result as an "absolute giveaway" and said it was a good effort from some of the football, but the team couldn't finish off the encounter.
It leaves United fourth in the league on 31 points behind Arsenal and five short of Chelsea.

Ferguson describes the result as an "absolute giveaway" following Fulham's late equalizer by Diop.
Despite a commendable performance, United remains fourth in the league on 31 points, four behind Arsenal and ten behind Chelsea.
